course.title: Complete Guide to TensorFlow for Deep Learning with Python
course.subtitle: Learn how to use Google's Deep Learning Framework - TensorFlow with Python! Solve problems with cutting edge techniques!

reviews.body: I liked the flow of training course and the simple way of explaining such complicated topics. Kudos to Jose!!
Good Samples could add something with large dataset to show the power of tensorflow

the explanation/ teaching is not good, and valid question have not been answered since past 2 years. Even few of the question I had asked was not answered.

If the explanation was good enough , no one would have questions in the first place.

It is a good match to me.

Some feedback:

1. I would have spent more time on basic mathematical background (e.g. - matrix multiplication, some other pillars in linear algebra, etc...)

2. The time it takes to exercise is at least twice, more likely thrice or even more the time it takes to just play the lectures. It could be useful if you ask for users feedback for the time it takes them to exercise each lecture, and then provide some data for the average (e.g. - the course is 14 hours, most users who exercise all parts, complete it in 55 hours (or, whatever the average is)
It have been an amazing experience for me. I'm learning and understanding with high efficiency by the instructions of the teacher. Congratulations!

A great introduction to TensorFlow and the various types of deep learning networks available. Different APIs are explained to generate the models. The course gives you the foundation to build and experiment on your own models and projects.
The code along uses tf1 which is already outdated so will need some effort to alter the codes to tf2.

The good thing about this course is that it contains a lot of material and the theoretical part is well explained. The main drawback however is that it is based on TensorFlow 1 and therefore many elements used in the exercises are obsolete. Some steps in practical sessions aren't properly explained.
TF version used is outdated but the content is still very relevant, it would be better if it examples were shown in Keras in TF2
The tutor MISSES ALOOOOT of content non explained Last time Ill take a course with you sir

Some things were really hard to understand watching these videos. I needed more pictures and real cases.

But there were a lot of various code examples, that I can return to later, when I start to work with my own projects.
There are theoretical gaps in his explanations. Some code along examples are fine but there are some topics that could go quicker as they were previously introduced during the lectures.

instructor.name: Jose Portilla
instructor.briefIntroduction: Jose Marcial Portilla has a BS and MS in Mechanical Engineering from Santa Clara University and years of experience as a professional instructor and trainer for Data Science and programming. He has publications and patents in various fields such as microfluidics, materials science, and data science technologies. Over the course of his career he has developed a skill set in analyzing data and he hopes to use his experience in teaching and data science to help other people learn the power of programming the ability to analyze data, as well as present the data in clear and beautiful visualizations. Currently he works as the Head of Data Science for Pierian Data Inc. and provides in-person data science and python programming training courses to employees working at top companies, including General Electric, Cigna, The New York Times, Credit Suisse, McKinsey and many more. Feel free to contact him on LinkedIn for more information on in-person training sessions or group training sessions in Las Vegas, NV.
